pullRequest.body:
Fourth PR in a sequence to implement the notion of topological entropy for maps using Bowen-Dinaburg's formalism. This file deals with the entropy of two systems related by a semiconjugacy.

- [x] Dynamical uniformities
- [x] Topological entropy via covers
- [x] Topological entropy via nets
- [x] Behaviour under semiconjugacy
- [ ] Behaviour for subsets and unions
- [ ] Behaviour under products
- [ ] Full shift

There is only one new file, `Dynamics.TopologicalEntropy.Semiconj`, which is quite short (200 lines including the documentation), and no other modification. I must say I am quite pleased by `coverEntropy_image`.

Paging @pitmonticone @sgouezel

---

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsDynCoverOf.preimage`

`+ coverEntropyInfEntourage_image_le`

`+ coverEntropy_restrict`
`+ coverEntropy_restrict_subset`
`+ coverMincard_image_le`
`+ justifies`
`+ le_coverEntropyEntourage_image`
`+ le_coverEntropyInfEntourage_image`
`+ le_coverMincard_image`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: D-Thomine can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11297528616/job/31424599710)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11297528616/job/31424599925)

Wouldn't it be more natural to use `s.image φ` in the statement, like
```suggestion
    IsDynCoverOf T (φ '' F) V n (s.image φ) := by
```
(because sometimes it can be relevant to know where the covering set is located), and then deduce your existential statement in a second lemma if you really need it?
Done, with a twist (I work with sets instead of finsets to avoid an annoying [DecidableEq Y] hypothesis).

In most situations, I expect that people will already have a uniform structure on the space above, so maybe it's worth emphasizing in the lemma name that it's not designed for this case. Maybe rename it `coverEntropy_image_of_comap`?
Same thing for the next lemma.

Is it enough to assume that \phi is uniformly continuous on the union of the iterates of F (or just on F if it is invariant)? I am imagining a situation where \phi is continuous but not uniformly continuous, and F is compact and invariant (which is a pretty common situation). Then the inequality between entropies should hold, but I don't think the current formulation would get it.

Good idea. It's still a bit raw, but I added 4 new lemmas :

- `coverEntropy_restrict` is generalized to any subset of an invariant set: `coverEntropy_restrict_subset`/`coverEntropyInf_restrict_subset `
- I leverage this generalization to get `coverEntropy_image_le_of_uniformContinuousOn_invariant`/`coverEntropyInf_image_le_of_uniformContinuousOn_invariant`

The later statement is the inequality of entropies between `F` and `φ '' F` whenever `φ` is uniformly continuous on an invariant subset `G` which contains `F`.

Taking `G = univ`, we recover `coverEntropy_image_le_of_uniformContinuous`. Taking `F = G`, we recover the case where `F` is invariant. Taking `G` as the union of iterates of `F`, we recover your first statement.

I am keeping `coverEntropy_restrict` for its conceptual importance, and `coverEntropy_image_le_of_uniformContinuous` because it's pretty clean (I think this is the one which would most often be used) and helps in the proof of the more general statement. I don't think it's worth writing the other consequences, because everything should be plug-an-play from here, but I can still add them if needed.
Can you fix the names in this docstring?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Dynamics.TopologicalEntropy.Semiconj): topological entropy and semiconjugacies
